name: The Mirage Hotel & Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved this one!!
reviews.title: one word...GREAT!

reviews.text: Room was great...prefer it to the Venetian which we have stayed at. But the BIG drawcard is the pool. Great amenity though get in early to get a lounge chair....this TOTALLY beat pools at many other Las Vegas hotels.....including the Venetian.
reviews.title: Do yourself a favor stay at The Mirage!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great and is cenral to the Fashion Show Mall and the 'BIG' casino drawcards that you can walk around for hours every night - Venetian, Paris, Bellagio, Caesars - and the staff were more than helpful.
reviews.title: Vegas galore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back here soon for sure!
reviews.title: Been staying here for 15 years

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first family vacation to Vegas.With so many hotels to choose from, it tends to be a little confusing, because they are all nice and have different themes. We did a little research from reviews and people that have been to Vegas before. As simple as I can put it, The Mirage was a absolutely the PERFECT choice for us. I honestly cannot even think of one thing I could complain about!!! Even if I knit picked I cannot!! Central location, clean, beautiful, eye - popping , sublte, classy, excellent satff and service, fantastic pool, plenty of chairs,( get there early!!) wide variety of food choices, a little sticker shock but thats to be expected. Starbucks, A great Deli, BLT Burger, all excellent. We had 2 Queen beds, flat screen t.v. ,big bathroom, Very clean!! fast elevators!! AWESOME HOTEL!!!!!!! Bring comfortable shoes, your shades, and soak it all in. Visited many other hotels while there, All the major hotels are excellent choices, but based on gettin the most BANG FOR YOUR BUCK , The Mirage was da bomb for us!!!!! WELL DONE MIRAGE!!!!!!!
reviews.title: 2nd time this year!

reviews.text: I will return to The Mirage again and again. ALWAYS a stellar experience. I love the tropical atmosphere and the smell of coconuts! This has always been my favorite place to stay while in Las Vegas. Every other hotel I've stayed at has had some minor (or major) annoying problem. Never at the Mirage.
reviews.title: I LOVE the Mirage!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simple amazing!! I loved it..
reviews.title: Best time ever

reviews.text: great service and great everything.. perfectly located! and a very good price.
reviews.title: Excited to stay, but did not meet expectations, disappointed!

reviews.text: It was very cold, so I couldnt go the pool, but it looked great, the spa was fantastic however.. Great deal for my honymoon
reviews.title: Enjoyed stay....but the more you visit other hotels...the more mirage feels dated !!

reviews.text: My sister and I stayed at the Mirage for our first overnight girls trip without our infants. We visit Vegas 3-4 times a year but had not stayed at the Mirage until this weekend. We had read great reviews and were excited to stay. The location is great, however the cleanliness of the rooms was not. We were able to check in early and the front desk associate stated that she had given us a complimentary upgrade to a pool view room. However, when we got to the room (12th floor)our view was of a drained pool through some bushes. We had to switch our room 4 times due to the rooms not being cleaned properly! The first room had stains with a dripping pattern down the entire headboard and ripped, stained sheets and comforter. We called down to the front desk where they said they would switch our room. When we arrived at the second room (11th floor) the musty dirty smell was overwhelming. We again called the front desk where we were given a 3rd room (16th floor) but told that our keys may not work and we would have to wait for someone to bring them back up. We were let in by security and hoping to finally get to relax but yet had stains covering the sheets, rings of dirt and hair all over the nightstand. I then went down to the front desk and spoke with a manager and showed her the pictures we had taken of the rooms. She apologized, gave us a new room and a $50 food and beverage credit for the inconvenience of having to switch rooms yet again. The fourth and final room (23rd floor) had a beautiful strip view but also had blood stained sheets and what looked like remnants of vomit on the headboard. I called down and spoke with the same manager. She sent a housekeeping manager and they proceeded to wipe everything down and strip the beds and replace them with new sheets and comforters. This whole process was at least a 2 hour process. I' not sure if it was our bad luck or lack of housekeeping. We have stayed in numerous hotels and recently stayed with my husband at the Aria Sky Suites a few weeks ago, but have never experienced rooms that were not cleaned to this extent. We will be returning to Vegas in April with our husbands and will be looking for a different resort to stay at.
reviews.title: Great Night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time to stay at the Mirage and we had a great experience. For starters the location is fantastic. Almost everything you need/want is within walking distance. The hotel itself is very clean and the staff is very friendly and efficient. In my opinion, the hotel (considering the gaming, restaurants, size, entertainment, etc.) is on par with any of the other big name hotels on the strip. The only restaurants we ate at were Kokomo's and California Pizza Kitchen, which were both excellent. Kokomo's is especially good for the atmosphere and the service. There is also a Starbucks in the hotel for all you coffee addicts. According to my girlfriend the spa and treatments were fantastic. So much so that she was there for five hours one of the days :-).
reviews.title: New Years Trip

reviews.text: The room itself was very accommodating and comfortable. It had all your standard features such as, flat screen television, ipod clock dock, mini bar, work station, safe, etc. Housekeeping was very quick to respond to anything we needed and the room service was delivered faster than any other hotel I have stayed at on the strip. Probably the only complaint would be the noise level in the room from the hallways. The hallways transfer a lot of noise into the rooms with all of the tile on the floor. So it is very easy to hear people laughing, talking, or running down the hallways. Overall, this is a great choice for New Years or anytime in my opinion.
reviews.title: Beautiful and great, central location on the Strip

reviews.text: My most recent visit to Las Vegas had me staying at the Mirage. The rooms are beautiful, beds very comfortable, great views, beautiful pool area, but the best part is the central Strip location. I was able to walk to most of the venues on the Strip (Boulevard). Although this hotel is large, it isn't as big as many of the others so it's services are good. This is a great centrally located hotel in Las Vegas.
reviews.title: Girls Weekend at the Mirage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a beautiful view of the strip from our 25th floor suite. The VIP lounge was very accommodating and the staff was always very gracious. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family!
reviews.title: I thought it would be a little nicer

reviews.text: This hotel isn't bad, but I guess I was thinking it would be a little nicer for the price. Windows sure were dirty, but I get the feeling that is just the way it is in Las Vegas. Bed was comfortable. Walk from check-in desk to room seemed to be about a 1/2 mile. It was 137 strides just from the elevator down the hall to my room. Room did not have any hand towels or wash cloths and it they did not deliver any until I had asked for them twice. I think the Concierge expected a tip for checking me in for my flight home, but since the hotel charges an extra $20 a night for this service, I was not in the mood to tip her. That extra $20 a night is a joke. Just add it to the rate. I guess it also gets you a daily newspaper and Internet access. I am sorry, but that is not worth an extra $20 a night to me.
reviews.title: Best hotel on the strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since we stayed at the Mirage, we have been back to Vegas and stayed at the Vdara (reviewed also), I'm not sure what I was thinking, opting for a Priceline Deal that picked the Vdara for us, but had I had my own choice I would have been back at the Mirage!
reviews.title: Love this place!

reviews.text: ...really, I have no complaints.
reviews.title: Questionable Security & More Attendants at the Pool

reviews.text: I decided to give The Mirage another try after my disasterous visit last year. Everything seem to be fine. Check -in was a breeze. Front desk was very helpful. Room was clean and I asked to be near the elevator and my request was granted. By the time I settled and went downstairs to the casino it was after 1030PM. The Mirage needs more security. The slot machine area in particular needs more security. There are some machines which even though they are in the middle of the casino are isolated and i was approached a couple of times by questionable people.Twice I looked around for someone to come by and there was no one around. I felt very vulnerable. This was my major complaint. I have never worried when I stayed at The Bellagio or The Wynn but I worried at The Mirage.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel - Will be back!!!!

reviews.text: We also paid to stay at the Private Pool. You pay $50 per chair (non refundable) and the pool is a small private pool away from the large pool. This is not the clothing optional pool. I gave the guy working at the pool $20 for setting up my chair & umbrella and asked him if he would be around for the day. He said YES. We never saw him again. We waited over an hour for a simple fruit salad. It finally showed up an hour and half later and they took it off our bill.
reviews.title: Tired and needs updated

reviews.text: My next trip I will not stay at The Mirage. Thinking of the Cosmopolitan!
reviews.title: Crooks

reviews.text: Booked 2 rooms - a 1-bedroom tower suite & 1 room w a premium view in early Feb & got great rates on the rooms. (They will be more expensive as the weather warms up.) The tower suite room was fantastic - much larger than expected (A-33) altho the view wasn't great as it faced away from the Strip but it was very quiet. Much quieter than the Trump where we stayed last spring (Trump was v noisy due to the train tracks). Floor A is non-smoking. Loved being central on the Strip & also having all the amenities close by. Definitely recommend this hotel to others. Ate at the Carving buffet restaurant & was very pleasantly surprised by the quality & variety of food there. Highly recommend it as great value for $$.
reviews.title: Great experience & stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I stayed here for 3 nights leading up to our wedding in a standard room(aka deluxe room) and for 2 nights(for our wedding night and night after) in a one bedroom tower suite. The bed in our deluxe room was really comfy and the room was big, spacious and lovely and modern. Our tower suite was on the 2nd floor from the top, and boy I thought that our previous bed was comfy well this was like sleeping on a cloud you just melt right into the bed. We asked for a suite with a view of the strip and were lucky to get one on the corner of the hotel so we had a gorgeous view of both ends of the strip. The suite was just like a NY open plan penthouse with one whole wall(and corner) of floor to ceiling windows. The only two cons that we have is that there is a beatles sign on the higher floors(tower suites) of the hotel which ruins the view(photos) a bit as it is seen as a black honeycomb pattern from the inside but we wern't looking at the windows we were looking at the strip. Also if you request a corner suite there is a little 1-2 min walk from the elevators. The restaurants were a little pricey but there is heaps of cheaper options across the street(Denny's, Casino Royale, Maccas etc.). Over all we would stay here again, it's a luxury hotel without the price tag!
reviews.title: Great hotel, awesome beds and perfect central location!

reviews.text: When I satyed here not too long ago my review was positive. Well what happened? Room not clean very dusty, toilet handle broke off, temperature control way off and the internet part of their resort fee spotty. Check in line LONG, casino stinks and customer service is well there is none.
reviews.title: What Happened?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Traveled to Vegas specifically to see Cirque Du Soleil's "Love" so decided to stay at the Mirage, which is the home of the show. Got a good package deal through Southwest airlines (http://www.southwestvacations.com/Destinations/Destination.aspx?dest=LAS) that proved to be cheaper than purchasing the room and airline seperately.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is quite nice. The room was large, well appointed, and surprisingly quiet. I particularly liked that the non-smoking rooms had their own separate elevator that only serviced the non-smoking floors. It helped to keep the halls and rooms smoke free. Unfortunately, the only way to get to the non-smoking elevator was through the smoky casino - but I suspect that is true of nearly every casino hotel in Vegas.
reviews.title: My second stay at The Mirage!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has been many years since I have been to Vegas. The last time I was there, the Mirage was the place to go. After reading many reviews here I decided to stay here two nights here. (2 other nights were in Paris which I have written a review) The check-in process was effecient and quick. We paid for a premium view room. What we got was a view of the pool, BUT, this is only after you look at the roof of the building. The pool was at the far end of the roof. We requested a change as we paid for something better. We went up 10 floors but the view was the same. If you sit in the right spot in the room you could see the strip. The room itself was really nice and large and laid out well. The bed was Awesome as well as the bath shampoo, conditioners etc. They advertise a clock with ipod dock. The clock did not work. When we arrived it was unplugged. I plugged it in, but I could not figure out how to set to correct time. I unplugged it. The remote to the TV did not work. I could not check out via the TV because of this. The wireless Internet was poor. I brought a network cable that that worked well. The water pressure in the shower was OK, but the temperature kept changing from almost too cold to almost too hot constantly. The buffet was very good, especially the salad guy. The Tiger experience was nice but only $1 off for hotel guests. The pool was nice but extremely cold. Even with temperatures in the 90's the pool never warmed up. Maybe they have a chiller to keep it cold during the hot summer months? There are so many great hotels in vegas and for similar dollars you could have a better experience elsewhere.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: We had four nights staying at the Mirage at the beginning of May. Our room had a view of the strip and we could watch the volcano erupting without the crowds. The beds were very large and comfortable and housekeeping was of a very high standard. The casino was busy 24/7 but no noise was heard in the rooms. Fabulous place to stay.
reviews.title: Fabulous trip to Vegas

reviews.text: The mirage hotel caption is "Vegas Starts here" and with the mirage it really does, loved every second of it reception check in was very fast staff very knowledgeable and good directions to lifts and rooms as you could easily get lost as you have to go thought the casino like all hotels in Vegas to get to you room not a problem at all. As we got to our room we where welcomed with a very modern room with a great view of the strip. Lovely bathroom with fresh clean towels each morning the bed was just out of this world felt like i was sleeping on a cloud and best thing you can buy the sheets, towels, shampoo, bodybutter all in the hotel shop near the pool you can even buy the bed on the hotel web site!! The room was cleaned every day by a friendly housekeeper all credit to her the staff don't go slow at all would like to see some people on trip advisor who say they go slow try and clean 15 rooms in 3 hours them self. The pool was amazing with water falls, you need to try and get a sun bed 1st thing as pool gets busy between 9am and 1pm. Lots of restaurants to pick from, from Pizza's to fine dinning. we went to BLT Burger. The burgers are to die for! tip fat fries are like potato wades and skinny fries are french fries we also went into the Roasted bean lovely staff lovely salads cakes and onion bagels and cream cheese. Cravings buffet do different meals breakfast lunch and dinner the desserts bit you will be spoil so much to pick from, you can get the free tram from the Mirage to treasurer island where you can see a free show at night so much to see fantastic holiday thank you lasvegas
reviews.title: Vegas starts Here

reviews.text: I have stayed in many hotels in Vegas over the year to attend conferences and just for relaxation. Boy have things changed since the recession! While hotels are making higher profits than ever before (according to the financial news reports) many have cut staffing and services to the bone, including the Mirage! We were there for the catering convention recently (April 2013) and there were so many issues with this hotel that I would never want to go back, even though this was my first and only stay with them, it was not a good one! With the exception of the night manager Luis, our stay was very disappointing.... When you first walk in to the lobby you will notice the partitions for the construction of Tom Colicchio's new steak house, very obvious with big signage. I really don't care if Tom is Coming!!! What I do care about is that there was a 200 yard walk to the elevators through a casino that made you wander along paths designed to entice you to gamble. I get it, it's Vegas but not everyone wants to dump their cash into the slots upon arrival! The adult pool was closed, not even available for one day a week while the family pool closed at 5:00 PM. Really, in Vegas? Our conference was not over until 4:00! There was a huge attendee list so you would think that they would want the bar business at the pool? Guess not. My biggest gripe was COFFEE! You either order a pot via room service for 18.00 (2 cups) or go down stairs to one of the two coffee vendors and wait for 30 to 40 minutes for your hand crafted cup of expensive coffee! 5.50 for a small Latte...? What ever happened to in-room amenities? The booze was expensive in all the bars, 7.00 to 9.00 for a Corona. The restaurants were okay, nothing to write home about and they should probably change out California Pizza Kitchen with a signature restaurant like David Paul's. :) The servers in most of the bars and at the tables were really unhappy people, all signs of managements drive for dollars. Over all, the only thing that I really enjoyed were the conference facilities which were ample and the Hooka Lounge was happening at the Rhum Bar. Other than that, you can find much better hotels for around the same price or just a bit more, but when you are in Vegas, you really should enjoy the best it has to offer! Try the Wynn or Bellagio if you really want comfort and class!
reviews.title: It's all about the $$$ at the Mirage!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Mirage was clean. The Casino area smelled very bad. In order to get a place at the pool you would have to get in line at 8 am and almost run to a chair. Califonia Pizza was amazing. Room service was good, but very slow!!
reviews.title: Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at the Mirage - great room, great service, great food. The only drawback we had was the lack of wireless connection. 3 times they "fixed" the problem and 3 times it only worked for a short while.
reviews.title: Worth a 2nd stay

reviews.text: Had a great time in 2 different rooms & visited the Sigfried & Roy Secret Garden & Dolphin Habitat. It was great to see the animals & watch the trainers work with the dolphins. Even though I have young kids, they love the hotel. Just not enough food choices for them. If you get to stay in a suite, it is AWESOME!!
reviews.title: Family Getaway

reviews.text: We always enjoy our stay at the Mirage. The staff make you feel super comfortable. The casino has a mixed variety of slot games & tables. The rooms are above exceptional. Beautiful & most importantly clean. I would recommend this place to anyone who's looking for a great hotel!
reviews.title: Mirage was GREAT!

reviews.text: This resort is so attentive to guests needs, you can't help but feel valued and spoiled. Right in the centre of the Las Vegas Strip, in the middle of the action, yet it is also a serene oasis for the traveller.
reviews.title: Simply the Best

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel many times. They seem to be constantly remodeling. It is the best location for the SHOT Show and it has a cigar lounge called the Rhumbar which I enjoy. It does not have the nicest rooms on the strip but they are nice and clean and reasonable price wise....at least for Las Vegas. Room was very comfortable with the amenities I most require. Bed was very comfortable and I would have slept better but for the people who feel obligated to talk in their loudest voice coming down the hall at 3A.M. BLT Burger has a terrific burger. Buffet was average. Everything in Vegas is overpriced...but, its Vegas. I will stay there again next year.
reviews.title: Another visit to the Mirage...

reviews.text: This hotel is one of the much older hotels in Las Vegas and it shows! The floor of the room (8047) we stayed in was crooked! Carpets were very dirty, as was the windows. Bed (nearest the window) was super uncomfortable.
reviews.title: OK, hotel ... VERY smoky!

reviews.text: Like all hotels in Las Vegas this place reeks of stale nasty smoke. Yuk.
reviews.title: Great Location on the Strip
Mirage promotional deals
reviews.text: I had to be in Las Vegas for work, otherwise this disgusting place would never see me!
We only ate breakfast here (Carnegie's ... fake NY deli), absolutely horrid. Super slow service, oily, greasy food.
reviews.title: Music Terror and very slow Internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We usually stay at the MGM or Bellagio but they were full. We're M Life members (MGM groups reward card), so decided to try the Mirage. We got a 2 bedroom suite at ~$300 rate, for post Christmas.
reviews.title: Fun hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i came to this hotel when they opened nearly 25 years ago. was basically perfect back in the day. feels a bit outdated, but not bad. room was ok. pool was ok. fitness room was good. gaming was good. dealers and bartenders were very nice, friendly and helpful. food was not so good. we ordered room service for breakfast. 2 meals and a small coffee. 55 bucks and the food was terrible....but friendly service. also, no coffee maker in room. major deduct. would probably go back because the staff really is good.
reviews.title: pretty good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second trip to Las Vegas, and my husband's first. We had a really good time, and the bed was so comfortable. I think the logic goes sometimes that your rooms don't matter, because once you are in Vegas you don't spend much time in them. That's true, you don't...but when you do, it's wonderful to have a clean room, a great bed, and a good solid sleep for the little time you are in it. The staff were so helpful, and I adored the Cravings buffet and Stacks, where I celebrated my birthday with good friends and the best lobster I've ever eaten. We would definitely come again.
reviews.title: I loved the Mirage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The mirage is an above avarage vegas joint. The casino is nice and the pool is great! If you would like to make your trip awesome book a cheap room (off season) and try upgrading it for a penthouse suite. The penthouse suites are great and huge 1200 sqf+. This is the only hotel I was 100% succesfull in upgrading each time. Staff is also great and helpfull.
reviews.title: Try upgrading

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time at the Mirage and it was wonderful. I cant say anything bad about it. Everything here was a PLUS. The pool and habitat were amazing, it was very nice and relaxing. I really hope to stay here again.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had purchased tickets to the Beatles LOVE show. We selected the Mirage for the convenience. We arrived earlier than the 3pm check-in and asked if a room was available for early check-in. We understood that it wasn't available and were able to store our bags with the bellman.We were told that a text would be sent to our phone when the room was available. We walked through the hotel and had lunch. By 3:30 we hadn't heard anything. When we checked again at the front desk we were told that there was a problem with our room. We received an apology and an alternate room. But when we arrived at the new room we discovered it had two queen beds, not the king bed that we reserved. We called the front desk and a security representative was sent up to let us into a room with a king bed.
reviews.title: I had hoped for better

reviews.text: Not a whole lot going on inside the hotel, but a very good location for venturing out. Expect to be entertained outside as opposed to inside. Service and aesthetics were excellent though.
reviews.title: Solid Choice, Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the the Mirage to be a very busy place. Checking in at 11:00 AM involved standing in line for 20 minutes. The rooms are nice - we had a decent size room on the 25th floor of the tower and no complaints. There is the fact that nowhere on the strip do they ahve a coffee maker in the room So, you have trek to a Starbucks or similar to pay $3.75 for a cup to start your day. Our bathroom was deluxe with a jetted tub and separate shower and two sinks. The Mirage has some good restaurants and we enjoyed many of them. BB Kings Blues Club had the best breakfast on the strip. I am amazed they still allow smoking in the casino.
reviews.title: A better hotel experience in Las Vega

reviews.text: All in all, a better hotel with good amenities.
reviews.title: Watch Your Valuables

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is good enough: good location, standard room, smokey but nice enough casino. Our problem was that, when we got home, we discovered that someone had stolen my husband's iPad when we checked our luggage with the bellman. For a hotel that proports to "pamper" you, and with no posted sign at the bellman's station warning you not to check valuables, we expected better. Maybe we were just dumb tourists, but we have checked luggage in Canada, New York City, LA, Buenos Aires, Santiago and Lima, and never had a thing stolen. We have yet to hear from the hotel, despite numerous letters. My suggestion? Stay at Caesars Palace!
reviews.title: good hotel and good location on the strip

reviews.text: Me and my girlfriend stayed at this hotel in dec 2011 we were in vegas for 2012 so about this hotel well i have stayed on alot of hotels around the world and i had no problems at all we stayed on non smoking floor the casino and the 24 hr going on's was unreal new yrs was fantastic as the strip was closed that evening for everyone to walk about the tram from the mirage to TI (treasure island) was very handy A BIG MUST is to go to mystere in TI unbelievable. when walking about on the strip do not fall for any one selling timeshares just say no thank and walk on otherwise you will be in ther for hrs lucky us we got out of it the food in vegas is truly gorgeous the steaks are fab one restaurant i will mention is THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY just go and you will not believe the amount of food you get and good value and gorgeous food this is in the forum shops next door to the mirage the beds in the mirage are heaven be careful with the mini bar if you move anything you will be billed i managed to get a small water in ther without been billed just get the ice from vending machine they are on every floor and fill the ice bucket to keep drinks cool but overall the people cannot do enough for you at the hotel we were there for 13 nights a bit too long 7 days more than enough we didn't gamble so cannot comment but to see it all going on is amazing
reviews.title: Decent hotel but few amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Twice in two years and willbe back again. Fantastic pool, great location, luxurious rooms...what more can you ask for?! Check in was fine and accommodated a change of room the second night to a Strip view. One of the best pools in Vegas with room for all....shade or full sun. We had more at our doorstep than we can even make use of in a week-long stay.....even a gay-night night-club (Sunday's for those who are interested)! Regularly updated and looking a lot fresher than some of the younger hotels on the Strip and HIGHYL recommended!
reviews.title: The best...again!

reviews.text: There is nothing much unusual about the Mirage. It is a big hotel and casino with many of the same things the others offer and decent rooms. What sets them apart is the hospitality. With great consistency, this is the most helpful and hospitable staff on the strip. Makes a big difference.
reviews.title: Service Makes the Difference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2nd stay here in the past 5 months. Beautiful place, great location. Used the pool this time and the chairs are way too close together to enjoy yourself. Too bad, cause it is really nice. Stayed at 3 places this trip and of all the rooms, this was the worst. Even New York New York had nicer rooms. Seriously, a camper has a larger bath tub than here! May not be a biggy to alot of people, but to me it is. Could care a less about the view, but I do like to bath every night after gambling and walking. This time we were still down the hall quite far and let me tell you, it doesn't matter where your room is....it will still be noisy! Can't be helped if the doors don't close all the way because there is no seal. When we approached our room, we could see inside the room through the side and top of the door. Both stays here our rooms were comped and neither time were we able to upgrade(even for a fee) to a larger bath room. So this part of the review is for those who gamble. The Mirage will offer a couple of nights free, never 5 or 7 we always stay. Although after staying for a couple, they are then willing to comp the rest of our stay, but never upfront. Hello, take a look at our play! We gamble the whole time we are there.Dollar machines and 25 to 50 bucks a hand at black jack.Now, after gambling, they do have good express comps and point play or cash back. Better than the Harrah's group. Also upfront, very seldom offers for cash free play. This time Caesars offered us 3 nights and 550.00 in free play. And when we checked in, they upgraded us to a suite with a jacuzzi. So why stay at the mirage as an mlife member? We have always managed to be a bit up or even after our 3 days here. And I know we spend the money, but is frustrating with some clubs that you play and play and then have to pay for meals, etc. So, on the gambling end. the mirage is a 4 for me, but the hotel itself is only a 3. Oh, and by the way, forget about ever getting a drink in this casino! Literally, hours or thousands before seeing a waitress. This trip, after our first night, a floor worker recognized us from the night before and she made sure a waitress came by. The duration of our stay she would check regularly to make sure we were being looked after. Can't remember her name but thanks so much! So, to make a long story short, we will probably continue to return until we lose our butts! Then I guess there will nothing to lure us back! Also other reviews complained about the cleanliness of the rooms,.... this is true. Neither stay our carpet had been vacuumed before we got into our room and this time there were curly hairs at the base of the toilet from check in till check out! My husband had to fix our toilet everyday, The internet never worked and although they said they would send someone up, they never did in the time we were there.Ate at Carnegie deli(awesome again), blt burger(good as always), the buffet(not even close to worth 27.00 for breakfast, it was all cold), and tried to eat at bb kings but after sitting at a table for 20 mins. and noone even acknowledged us, we got up and left.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at The Mirage October 6 to 10th. I had contacted the hotel's guest relations officer, Christine, and she arranged that we could have a fridge in the room for my medications and made sure that we would get the kind of room we requested. She even upgraded our room to a view of strip and volcano, on the 20th floor which is the floor designated for smokers. She was very accommodating and even did a follow up after we checked in to make sure we were satisfied with everything.

reviews.text: If we ever come back to Vegas this is definitely the hotel I would stay at. It had everything you could ask for - a great central location on the Strip, renovated casino, rooms and bathroom plus a super comfy bed. The hotel is clean and in great shape. The pool area was always busy but there was someone around to help you find chairs.

reviews.text: Overall, just a really great experience!
reviews.title: Vegas really did start here.
good location and prices
reviews.text: As the motto states, Vegas starts here! What a truly, amazing holiday. We stayed from April 14th until April 21st 2013 and had the most wonderful time. One week just wasn't long enough to take in all the sights and attractions that Las Vegas has to offer and the Mirage hotel and casino was an awesome base to take shelter. From the moment that we arrived, everything about the hotel impressed us, from the sheer size of the resort to the cleanliness and the efficiency and friendliness of the check-in lobby staff. We were greeted with real smiles (when a person is happy in their job and takes real pleasure in helping guests you can tell in their eyes) and the extent of their helpfulness and willingness to go that extra mile for their guests excelled. Yes you do have to walk through the casino to access the guest elevators but that's the same in most Vegas hotels, no? and if you don't want to part with your money and gamble it away then simply don't. As for the guest rooms... that bed!! WOW. It was like sleeping on a cloud for 7 nights. Everything clean, housekeeper was friendly and worked hard. Everything always replenished when needed and little extra touches here and there make it more personal and special. We had a fab outlook from the room onto part of the strip from floor 17 - glad of a higher floor as i think being at the bottom a view might be limited depending on where the room is located. Down now to the pool and sunbathing area, what a pool! Be prepared to arrive early for a decent sunbathing spot though and this was only April.. however that's nothing to moan about as it's more or less the same all over the world. The pool is brill though, clean and spacious and great for cooling off in the Vegas sunshine! Comfortable beds around the pool and friendly, hard working staff serving drinks as and when if required. We didn't eat around the pool but the Paradise Cafe looked inviting and would of liked to have had a bite to eat there but somehow didn't end up trying it. Oh also, the hot tub is AMAZING. As for eating in the hotel - BLT Burger is THE place for the most tastiest and sexiest burgers around! Even if you're not a burger person, these are different somehow and just so tasty.. damn i'm hungry now thinking about it. Oh and the milkshakes.... this is what you call a milkshake! Cravings buffet for breakfast, lunch and dinner was also real good value with various cooking stations for all your different tastebud needs and wants.. heaps of food, tasty and awesome desserts! Some of the servers did look a bit stressed out through being so busy and forgot things at times but a friendly reminder and all was fine, they were however friendly and apologetic. I must say... the Roasted Bean was an amazing place to get a cup of tea! pastries, cakes, bagels, wraps, salads.. this place was a little godsend to us and the staff were friendly and always smiling, good atmosphere. There were various other places to eat and drink inside the hotel from casual to fine dining and although we didn't try all of them in the week they certainly looked busy and popular. Bars and lounges looked the part, especially the RHUMBAR.. in full swing, looked awesome. The Mirage's very own Siegfried & Roy's secret garden and dolphin habitat... View White tigers and the chance to get up close and personal with beautiful dolphins, nice little retreat from the chaos of Vegas. Wishing we had of got the chance to see Cirque du Soleil's 'The Beatles-Love' live from the Mirage but simply did not have the time to fit everything into one weeks stay. Oh the volcano that errupts nightly outside at the Mirage on the hour every hour is well worth a watch! Catch the Mirage tram straight down to Treasure Island to save those little legs! At the beginning of the week you walk EVERYWHERE to take everything in and so you don't miss a thing, by the end of the week you've walked that far (the strip is bigger than you think) that your feet are twice the size and walking anywhere becomes effort! We only found out on the last night that you could catch a monorail from the back of Harrah's hotel to either direction, towards Stratosphere or to the right down towards MGM Grand right at the other end of the strip, cheap fast and efficient and just saves those feet when they begin to throb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, would definitely recommend staying at the Mirage and will no doubt return in the future. Staff work very hard and deserve more credit - All praise to housekeeping staff who guests sometimes seem to forget about, if it wasn't for these guys then you wouldn't return at the end of the day to a beautiful room... duh! Give them a smile, say hello and give them some gratitude. ANYWAY, fantastic holiday in Las Vegas... Thank you Mirage!
reviews.title: Love the Mirage

reviews.text: Second time at the Mirage. It's beautiful and comfortable and less expensive than several of the mega-resorts in the area. Easy walk to Venetian, Bellagio, Caesars, etc, but less costly. Rooms and beds are comfortable. Casin.o is as good as the majors. Great restaurants - Stacks, Japonaise, Carnegie Deli, etc. - some expensive and some very reasonable. Night clubs seem insanely busy on weekends, but look like no shortage of folks waiting on lines to get in. Little disappointed with check in folks who didn't explain breakfast discounts at Cravings. Typical Vegas BS refrigerators in rooms are weight sensitive - so don't go near them uless you are OK paying $8 for a small bag of peanuts. Regardless, enjoyable place to stay for a short visit to LV.

Fine choice for a biz trip
reviews.text: I should preface this by saying this was my first time in LV (hard to believe, I know) and I was only there for a work conference - so my review won't include a ton of extra "stuff" about the Mirage and all of its facilities, restaurants, etc.

I thought the place was fine - clean, recently renovated and decent room service, although nothing out of the ordinary. One thing that wasn't fine - I came in and the bed was short-sheeted. The housekeeper remade it with sheets that FIT, but I had to ask (and she was annoyed). But other than that, this was a pretty uneventful stay. The hotel itself is HUGE - and pretty nice, but like I said, I was there for work so really didn't get to do a whole lot other than sit in a conference room (it was a pretty nice conference room, speaking of which!). However, a lot of people who know Vegas (and I don't) wished we had stayed at the Wynn or another of the newer and fancier hotels for whatever that's worth...
reviews.title: Great location and fun hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at the Mirage in Vegas during Columbus Day weekend, with tickets to see the Garth Brooks show at the Wynn. We bought a vacation package through Southwest Airlines for three nights at the MIrage. It was very good . Definitely worth what we paid for it and was a perfect location. The hotel is crazy busy though especially on Friday and Saturday nights but it was fun!
reviews.title: Very nice rooms!

reviews.text: Had a great room, a Tower Deluxe room, nice and modern, plenty of room, good bathroom with excellent lighting. Visited the Dolphin Habitat and enjoyed watching the young dolphins play. The casino is decent, but older, and the hotel check-in comes right out of a Disney queuing theory nightmare, be prepared to wait in a long line to check in. They have a good selection of restaurants from decent to expensive, and good conference facilities.
reviews.title: Definately Stay Here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled as a group of 6, to celebrate my friend Vinnie's 40th birthday, staying for 4 nights (14th-18th Jan 2013) We all thought the hotel and casino were amazing!
reviews.title: Nice hotel!

reviews.text: I loved this hotel. The only negative thing was that the elevators were far away from the lobby so you have to treck through the casino with all your crap. But once you're settled in, it's really a beautiful hotel. We had a view of Caesar's and the end of the trip all the way to MGM. There's a wonderful tiger and dolphin exhibit which i highly recommend for animal lovers! The pool is big and there's plenty of seating and waitresses to keep the drinks coming! I didn't gamble while I was at the MIrage so I can't comment on that. The best part about the hotel and my stay was by far the Terry Fator show. I watched him on America's Got Talent and I was soo looking forward to his show. For not very much money (let's say 1/3 of what I paid to see Celine Dion, which was also an amazing concert!) I sat in the second row right in front of the stage. It was funny, hilarious, and most definitely entertaining! The room was very nice, quiet, and like I said previously, came with a wonderful view! The Roasted Bean was a wonderful breakfast place. My mom and I got breakfast here every morning...the coffee, yogurt, and pastries are to die for! I would definitely recommend staying here.
reviews.title: Great hotel in the middle of the strip!

Unfortunately, we would not stay here again because of that alone. What a shame!

When we arrived we just took a shuttle bus to the hotel, very convient and affordable. We ate at the BLT and the California Pizza both were excellent. But if you just want a quick bite to eat there is a Panda Express, McDonalds and a Chipotle across the street. My only complaint is don't expect to get a drink in the casinos the waitresses are few and far between. We spet most of the time at Rhumbar which we loved great bartenders there.
